sentence.Network_cn: 一座爱德华七世时代的排屋

sentence.Network_en: The furniture strikes a traditional note which is appropriate to its Edwardian setting.
sentence.Network_cn: 这些家具给人一种古香古色的感觉，与周围爱德华七世时期风格的布置很协调。

sentence.Network_en: But in the end it transpired that the allusion was characteristically to an Edwardian popular song.
sentence.Network_cn: 但后来表明,这首诗是典型地模仿了爱德华七世时期的一首流行歌曲.

entry.def: Edwardian means belonging to, connected with, or typical of Britain in the first decade of the 20th century, when Edward VII was King.

example.tran: 他的爱德华七世时代建造的古老办公室

means.word_mean: 1. someone belonging to (or as if belonging to) the era of Edward VII
1. of or relating to or characteristic of the era of Edward VII in England;

auth_sentence.content: Genesis had virtually invented their own genre, Edwardian rock.
